box.io¶

Module provides some input/output functionality.

class box.io.rich_input(prompt=None, **kwargs)¶

Bases: box.functools.function.FunctionCall

Read a string from standard input.

Parameters:
  • prompt (str) – default prompt
  • kwargs (dict) – key=value pairs of parameters

When you called function with any kwarg it overrides class attributes and changes function behaviour. See parameter list below. All of them you can use in function call. Also all of them you can redefine in inherited class.

separator = ': '¶

Symbols to end prompt.

default = None¶

Default value if user will not input anything.

options = None¶

List of available options.

attempts = 3¶

How many attempts user have to match one of the available option.

error = 'Try again..'¶

Print when user fails to match one of the available option.

hint_indent = ' '¶

Indent before hint.

hint_borders = '[]'¶

Borders around hint.

hint_separator = '/'¶

Separator to separate available options.

static hint_on_default()¶

Function called on default value in available options.

static input([prompt]) → string¶

Base input function. For example you can use getpass.getpass.

static print(value, ..., sep=' ', end='n', file=sys.stdout, flush=False)¶

Base print function. For example you can use pprint.pprint.

prompt = 'Input'¶

Default prompt.

rendered_prompt¶

Exactly what will be printed to user as prompt.

rendered_error¶

Exactly what will be printed to user as error.

templated_prompt¶

Prompt template.

templated_error¶

Error template.

context¶

Context to make rendered_* from templated_*.

formatted_options¶

Options as a string.

formatted_default¶

Default as a string.

hint_left_border¶

Left border for hint.

hint_right_border¶

Right border for hint.
